Welcome

irrB [ urb] is a tool that makes it easy to integrate content created in Blender into your Irrlicht based application. It is unlicensed which means it is completely free to use.

It has excellent support for Irrlicht's native scene nodes and materials.

irrB is under constant development. The following features are present, work fine and can be seen “in action” in the embedded YouTube video:

  • Output formats: Generates Irrlicht native scene (.irr) and mesh (.irrmesh) files. All generated output may optionally be packed into a single .zip file.
  • Scene nodes: Exports Mesh, Camera, Light, Sky Box/Dome, Billboard, and other native Irrlicht scene node types.
  • Materials: Provides fine grained control over the existing Irrlicht material types as well as allowing for custom Material types.
  • Collision and Physics: Generates Collision and Physics data that may be used by Irrlicht's native collision system and 3rd party physics libraries (Bullet, PhysX, ODE, and Newton).
  • Preview: Scene and Mesh data may optionally be previewed after exporting using irrB's own iwalktest utility or your own application.
  • Miscellaneous: Octree nodes, hardware mapping hints, Irrlicht vertex types, packed UV images, and automatic conversion from Blender to Irrlicht's coordinate system.

Viewing exported scenes in Irrlicht couldn't be easier using irrB's "walk testing" integration. Walk testing may be performed with the irrB supplied iwalktest utility or your own custom Irrlicht based application.

Get irrB

irrB is available as a download from the Tubras Google Code Project Downloads page.

You can view the irrB Python source code in the Subversion repository located at http://tubras.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/tools/irrb/io_export_irrlicht.py .
